metadata.title: CVE-2024-0646 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: An out-of-bounds memory write flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™sTransport Layer Security functionality in how a user calls a functionsplice with a ktls socket as the destination. This flaw allows a local userto crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty/esm is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty/esm is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty/esm is affected and may need fixing.
